page.title: 04Crown Hotel,Framlingham.
page.content: The busiest time in the Crown Hotel is the mid summer. The hotel can take as many as twenty nine guests. There are seventeen bedrooms. Many German, French,Italian and Americans stay there. The hotel employs eighteen full time staff and two part time workers. The guests' favourite meal is roast beef, Yorkshire pudding and roast potatoes, with chocolate hazelnut meringue to follow. In March a new roof was put on the hotel and more bedrooms are to have private bathrooms. The hotel was first built as a lodging for Mary Tudor's knights when she visited Framlingham Castle in 1554. The main entrance used to be the carriage entrance to the stables. The hotel has three ghosts. It is a three star hotel. Interview with Mr. Steen, hotel manager.
